description: Documentation for the Hologram component model

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: The Hologram component model defines the complete structure of all components. Every component is composed of exactly 9 files: 1 specification, 1 implementation, and 7 conformance files.

sections.title: Core Requirements
sections.content: Every component must have: spec (JSON Schema definition), implementation (the actual component), interface (public API), docs (documentation), test (test specifications), and manager (lifecycle management).

sections.title: Extended Requirements
sections.content: Additionally, every component must have: dependency (dependency declarations), build (build instructions), and log (logging interface). These ensure complete lifecycle management from development through production.

sections.title: Validation
sections.content: Components are validated against their schemas with strict enforcement. All 9 files must be present and valid for a component to be considered complete.

sections.title: Content Addressing
sections.content: All component files are content-addressed using SHA256 hashes, ensuring integrity and enabling deterministic references.
